thread.title: Re: Police escort Republican congressman from town hall; ‘Thought this was going to be an adult conversation’
thread.title_full: Re: Police escort Republican congressman from town hall; ‘Thought this was going to be an adult conversation’

author: unknown
title: Re: Police escort Republican congressman from town hall; ‘Thought this was going to be an adult conversation’
text:
Police escort Republican congressman from town hall; ‘Thought this was going to be an adult conversation’ Posted at 4:44 pm on February 4, 2017 by Brett T. 
Hundreds of protesters outside of Rep. Tom McClintock’s Saturday morning town hall in Roseville, Calif., are sticking the GOP congressman with the snowflake label after police escorted him from the event. Protesters have shown up at Rep. Tom McClintock's town hall meeting in Roseville. pic.twitter.com/YPjpFYzEpF 
— The Sacramento Bee (@sacbee_news) February 4, 2017 Large crowd turned out for @tommcclintock townhall in Roseville. @KQEDnews pic.twitter.com/eILVEbkDJD 
— Katie Orr (@1KatieOrr) February 4, 2017 Protesters in front of @tommcclintock town hall in Roseville. Line to get in stretches for several blocks in each direction. @KQEDnews pic.twitter.com/EcFCNpFXFa 
— Katie Orr (@1KatieOrr) February 4, 2017 This is the scene out Rep. Tom McClintock's town hall. We just made it inside after pleading with Roseville police. pic.twitter.com/13UaXMvWph 
— Max Resnik (@KCRAMax) February 4, 2017 All 200 seats inside Tower Theater filled for @tommcclintock town hall. Fire Department says couple hundred left outside. @KQEDnews 
— Katie Orr (@1KatieOrr) February 4, 2017 The head of Placer Co. GOP tells me he recognized a total of four supporters of Rep. McClintock inside the town hall. 
— Max Resnik (@KCRAMax) February 4, 2017 This in a district where @realDonaldTrump won 54% & McClintock won 63% in November. @1KatieOrr @KQEDnews https://t.co/Ez1AH9jOuc 
— Scott Shafer (@scottshafer) February 4, 2017 If you'd ever told me there'd be a protest against Tea Party Republican @RepMcClintock in Roseville I'd have said you were insane. pic.twitter.com/0AA9ssT31m 
— McClintock disliker (@MaryHartmanx2) February 4, 2017 Insane turnout at McClintock town hall in CA-4 @IndivisibleTeam pic.twitter.com/MbtabXMFqs 
— Seth L. Sanders (@SethLSanders) February 4, 2017 . @RepMcClintock meeting jumps right into discussion about repealing ACA. Many in room not happy with congressman's answers. @KQEDnews pic.twitter.com/8K9rrvbAMr 
— Katie Orr (@1KatieOrr) February 4, 2017 Someone pounding on an exit door to the theater. Not sure who. Hundreds have been left outside @RepMcClintock town hall meeting. @KQEDnews 
— Katie Orr (@1KatieOrr) February 4, 2017 Crowd at meeting cheers when woman says she's terrified of @realDonaldTrump @KQEDnews .She asks what @RepMcClintock will do to impeach him. 
— Katie Orr (@1KatieOrr) February 4, 2017 Crowd jeers when @RepMcClintock says a lot of people didn't like Pres. Obama either. @KQEDnews 
— Katie Orr (@1KatieOrr) February 4, 2017 Things tense in @RepMcClintock meeting. People yelling, "Stop lying!" McClintock says thought was going to be adult conversation. @KQEDnews 
— Katie Orr (@1KatieOrr) February 4, 2017 Since we made it inside, we've heard questions on climate change and infrastructure spending. Now onto healthcare. 
— Max Resnik (@KCRAMax) February 4, 2017 Man in @RepMcClintock meeting gets standing ovation after saying his wife could die if ACA repealed because she couldn't afford medicine. 
— Katie Orr (@1KatieOrr) February 4, 2017 David Emerson, in blue, tells Rep. McClintock his wife will die if GOP repeals ACA. She needs meds for heart condition. He's on fixed income pic.twitter.com/dc5BNHIa1q 
— Max Resnik (@KCRAMax) February 4, 2017 Pres. Trump's EO on immigration a significant topic, too. If there's anyone in here supporting it, they're not making their voices heard. 
— Max Resnik (@KCRAMax) February 4, 2017 Told can't interview @RepMcClintock after meeting because security concerns. Told they've received threats. Said any other time. @KQEDnews 
— Katie Orr (@1KatieOrr) February 4, 2017 Several people standing with "resist" signs in @RepMcClintock meeting. @KQEDnews pic.twitter.com/qc7hEbr1sG 
— Katie Orr (@1KatieOrr) February 4, 2017 Trending
